./.title: Introduction

getting-started.html.title: Getting Started

ngtemplate-api.html.title: ngTemplate API

template-expressions.html.title: Template Expressions
template-expressions.html.body:
Template ExpressionsTemplate expressions are being evaluated in the given scope. So we can reference scope variables within template e.g.
data-ng-if="foo" refers to foo variable of the scope and therefore:template.sync({ foo: true }); // show element
template.sync({ foo: false }); // hide element
We access scope objects the same way we do it in JavaScript e.g. data-ng-if="foo.bar" refers to foo.bar and can be toggled like this:template.sync({ foo: { bar: true } }); // show element
Expressions may have mixed scope variables and primitives:data-ng-if="foo && bar.baz || false"
data-ng-if="foo + 10  > 20"
We can pass rendering helpers (e.g. transformers) with the scope. For example we pass decorator to the directive data-ng-if="decorator(foo)" this way:{
  foo: "foo",
  decorator: function( val ){
    return "decorated " + val;
  }
}
Expressions are evaluated in the context of the target element, so we can access the element with this:data-ng-if="foo && this.checked"
NOTE: In order to gain better performance keep to primitive expressions especially in cyclic directives e.g. data-ng-text="foo.bar.baz",
data-ng-text="!foo.bar.baz", data-ng-text="'string here'", data-ng-if="foo.bar > baz.quiz", data-ng-text="foo + 10,
data-ng-if="true", data-ng-prop="'disabled', true || false", data-ng-data="foo || bar, baz".
Such expressions are being evaluated without use of eval() and therefore the process takes much less time and resources.
You can check how the parser treats your expressions by studying content of template.report().tokens array

template-directives.html.title: Template Directives
template-directives.html.body: Template DirectivesWe use HTML-compliant data-ng-* custom attributes to tell the template how exactly we want to bind the scope data to the element

ngtext.html.title: ngText

ngprop.html.title: ngProp
ngprop.html.body:
ngPropWe use ngProp to modify element's propertiesSyntax
 propertyName:string, expression => value:boolean|string" />

Examples
(new NgTemplate( document.body , `` ))

 .sync({ isDisabled: true });

console.log( document.body.innerHTML ); //

ngdata.html.title: ngData
ngdata.html.body:
ngDataWe use ngData to modify element's datasetSyntax datasetKey:string, expression => datasetValue:string" />
Examples(new NgTemplate( document.body , `` ))
  .sync({ value: "1960-10-03" });

console.log( document.body.innerHTML ); //

ngclass.html.title: ngClass
ngclass.html.body:
ngClassWe use ngClass to modify element's classListSyntax className:string, expression => toggle:boolean" />
Examples(new NgTemplate( document.body , `` ))
  .sync({ isHidden: true });

console.log( document.body.innerHTML ); // 
or(new NgTemplate( document.body , `` ))
  .sync({ isHidden: true, className: "is-hidden" });

console.log( document.body.innerHTML ); //

ngif.html.title: ngIf

ngfor.html.title: ngFor
ngfor.html.body:
ngForWe use ngFor when we need to generate a list of elements (subtrees)Syntax list:any[]" />
Examples(new NgTemplate( document.body , `` ))
  .sync({ rows: [ "foo", "bar" ] });

console.log( document.body.innerHTML ); // foobar

ngswitch.html.title: ngSwitch
ngswitch.html.body:
ngSwitchWe use ngSwitch when we need to display on element (subtree) of a set of available options.Syntax variable:string|number">
   value:string|number" />
  

Examples(new NgTemplate( document.body ,
  `
    FOO
    BAR
  ` ))
  .sync({ theCase: 1 });

console.log( document.body.innerHTML ); // FOO
(new NgTemplate( document.body ,
  `
    FOO
    BAR
    BAZ
  ` ))
  .sync({ theCase: 100 });

console.log( document.body.innerHTML ); // BAZ

ngel.html.title: ngEl
ngel.html.body:
ngElWe use ngEl to modify element properties:exclamation: NOTE: Using ngEl is rather discouraging as it cannot be cached and every model sync will
cause the DOM modification even if the expression of ngEl wasn't changedSyntax eval:void" />
Examples(new NgTemplate( document.body , `` ))
  .sync({ class: "is-hidden" });

console.log( document.body.innerHTML ); //
